document_title: Compensated cirrhosis: Symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
There are many causes that can lead to compensated cirrhosis. Among them, people with the following health problems may increase the risk of disease onset:
Have underlying diseases such as hepatitis B virus, hepatitis C virus, hepatitis D virus that are not well controlled; People with fatty liver disease; People who are overweight or obese; People who often abuse alcohol; Having an inadequate diet, too much fried food... affects liver function; Regular exposure to toxic substances such as arsenic, arsenic, etc. promotes the development of cirrhosis; Family history of liver diseases (2)
Alcohol abuse is one of the reasons for compensated cirrhosis
subsection_title: xo gan con bu.json. What causes compensated cirrhosis?
